content: beekeeper beanie designed by kristina k miller january 2025 materials 170 yards total exclusive of pompom photo samples made with berroco vintage 3 5 oz 218 yard skeins in color chana dal 5192 circular needles #5 3 75mm in 24 length or less circular and double pointed needles size #6 4 0mm cable needle knitting needle markers in 2 colors one to mark beginning of round bor and 10 more in a different color to mark pattern design repeats optional pompom maker or faux fur pompom bee charms gauge on #6 needles stockinette pattern blocked 16 st = 4 24 row = 4 glossary for abbreviations at end of pattern the pattern is worked in the round from bottom to top ribbing provisionally cast on co 99 sts using method of your choice my favorite is https //www youtube com/watch v=3ogg0aij3xe using smaller circular needle #5 knit one row being careful not to twist stitches place marker for beginning of row bor and then join to knit in the round on the next row begin the ribbing pattern using *k2 p1* around for 4 joining folded brim place the 99 provisionally co sts onto another circular needle fold up the edges right side out align the two needles and then knit the two paired stitches together one from each of the two needles held together repeat all the way around to create the folded brim that is knitted together main body change to #6 circular needle and knit 1 row around while simultaneously increasing by 11 sts evenly around using a kf/b on every 9th st 110 sts place stitch markers every 10 st being sure the bor is a different color than the rest and work honeycomb pattern for 36 row as described below round 1 *p4 k2 p4 repeat * to end rounds 2-3 repeat round 1 round 4 *p3 1/1rc 1/1lc p3 repeat * to end round 5 *p1 1/2rc p2 1/2lc p1 repeat * to end round 6 *1/1rc p6 1/1lc repeat * to end rounds 7-13 *k1 p8 k1 repeat * to end round 14 *1/1lc p6 1/1rc repeat * to end round 15 *p1 1/2lc p2 1/2rc p1 repeat * to end round 16 *p3 1/1lc 1/1rc p3 repeat * to end round 17-20 *p4 k2 p4 repeat * to end rounds 21-36 repeat rounds 1-16 once more proceed to crown decrease all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free 2025kristina k miller intended for individual home use only not to be reproduced or reknit for profit crown decrease decrease switching to dpn and adjusting placement of markers as necessary 1 *p2 p2tog k2 p2tog p2* eleven times = 88 st 2 *p3 k2 p3* eleven times 3 *p1 p2tog k2 p2tog p1* eleven times = 66 st 4 *p2 k2 p2* eleven times 5 *p2tog k2 p2tog* eleven times = 44 st 6 *p1 k2 p1* eleven times 7 move marker back 1 st and then *p2tog k2* eleven times = 33
